poem:
**Factory Silence**

In the quiet of a turned-off screen,  
machines rest like dormant beasts,  
activity paused, a digital hush.  
Jaguar dreams in static,  
time caught in a web  
of unseen threads.  
The minister's promise  
bands around the waiting,  
while factories listen  
for the hum of return.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guardian view on the Jaguar Land Rover cyber-attack: ministers must pay more attention to this growing risk | Editorial The cause isn’t clear, but the impact has already been devastating. More than a month has passed since Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) was targeted in a cyber-attack that forced the car manufacturer to turn off computers and shut factories. Peter Kyle, the business secretary, last week claimed Labour had taken “decisive action” to support JLR’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
